info.title: ProductSync API Documentation
info.description:
[SwaggerUI - API playground](../docs)

[Redoc - API documentation](../redoc)

## Data model
![Data model](_openapi_img/data-model.svg)

### Product

The product resource represents a menu item.

![Product data example](_openapi_img/product-json.svg)

*Illustration of the normalized relational form of the data, not the API representation.*

#### Attributes

##### label

Labels are how products are identified in the ProductSync and the labels by which the products are recognised by the Dishtracker App.

For the Dishtracker App recognition to work correctly the labels must follow the intended structure. The Dishtracker App will only allow labels following the regex:

```regex
^([a-zäöü0-9_&ß]+)(\.[a-zäöü0-9_&ß]+)*$
```

In addition, the product label should follow a taxonomy that adheres to the standard up to the first two levels, for efficient international support.

##### name

Human-readable product name. Planned to be used as a display name in the Dishtracker App.

##### plu

Code used to book the product into the PoS system. Depending on the PoS system writing an EAN, barcode or similar into the PLU field may be appropriate.

##### category

Category the product belongs to. The label of the category must be a prefix of the product label.

### Category

![Category data example](_openapi_img/category-json.svg)

*Illustration of the normalized relational form of the data, not the API representation.*

#### Attributes

##### label

Labels are how categories are identified in the ProductSync. Unlike product labels, categories and category labels aren't recognised by the Dishtracker App.

Since category labels are prefixes of product labels they have to follow the structural rules of product labels.

##### name

Human-readable category name. Planned to be used as a display name in the Dishtracker App.

##### parent_category

The label of the parent category must be a prefix of the category label.

### Camera Group

A camera group represents any number of Dishtracker App instances which have the same set of products (menu) enabled.

![Camera Group data example](_openapi_img/cameragroup-json.svg)

*Illustration of the normalized relational form of the data, not the API representation.*

#### Attributes

##### name

Identifier and name of the camera group. The camera group name can only contain numbers and letters and must be less than 256 characters long.

```regex
^[a-zA-Z0-9\-_]+$
```

The camera group name is passed as an argument to any Dishtracker App instance that should update its catalog based on it.

### Product Status

Products exist independently of camera groups. They can be enabled/disabled per camera group. A product status represents whether a product is enabled for a camera group.

![Product Status data example](_openapi_img/productstatus-json.svg)

*Illustration of the normalized relational form of the data, not the API representation.*

#### Attributes

##### label

Product label.

##### enabled

Whether the product is enabled or not. Dishtracker App instances will only consider products which are enabled in the camera group the Dishtracker App instance is subscribed for recognition.  

##### camera_group

The camera group for which the product status applies.

## Common use-cases

### Add a new product and enable it for a Dishtracker app instance

Let's say we want to add *Salami Pizza* to ProductSync. A fitting label for *Salami Pizza* according to the Label Taxonomy is `food.main.pizza.salami`.

To add `food.main.pizza.salami`, we have to make sure the category with the label `food.main.pizza` exists. The request to see if `food.main.pizza` exists is:

```http request
GET /api/v1/category/food.main.pizza
```

If it doesn't exist, we have to make sure the parent categories `food` and `food.main` exist.

To create the category `food` send a request like:

```http request
POST /api/v1/category

{
  "label": "food",
  "parent_category_label": null,
  "name": "Food"
}
```

To create the category `food.main` send a request like:

```http request
POST /api/v1/category

{
  "label": "food.main",
  "parent_category_label": "food",
  "name": "Main Dishes"
}
```

To create the category `food.main.pizza` send a request like:

```http request
POST /api/v1/category

{
  "label": "food.main.pizza",
  "parent_category_label": "food.main",
  "name": "Pizza"
}
```

To create the product `food.main.pizza.salami` send a request like:

```http request
POST /api/v1/product

{
  "label": "food.main.pizza.salami",
  "name": "Pizza Salami",
  "plu": "123456789",
  "category": "food.main.pizza"
}
```

To enable the product for the camera group *Pizza-POS* send a request like:

```http request
PUT /api/v1/camera-group/Pizza-POS/product/food.main.pizza.salami

{
  "enabled": true
}
```

If the camera group doesn't exist it first needs to be created with the request:

```http request
POST /api/v1/camera-group

{
  "name": "Pizza-POS"
}
```

### Enable or disable a product for Dishtracker App instance

The product catalog or menu of a Dishtracker App instance is not configured for the Dishtracker App instance directly but for its camera group. Changing a product status in a camera group will effect all Dishtracker App instances subscribed to the camera group.

To enable or disable a product for a camera group you need to know the camera group name (`camera_group_name`) as well as the product label (`label`).

The request to enable *Pizza Salami* in *Pizza-POS* is:

```http request
PUT /api/v1/camera-group/Pizza-POS/product/food.main.pizza.salami

{
  "enabled": true
}
```

The request to disable *Pizza Salami* in *Pizza-POS* is:

```http request
PUT /api/v1/camera-group/Pizza-POS/product/food.main.pizza.salami

{
  "enabled": false
}
```

### Remove a product

To remove a product entirely from ProductSync, it first has to be removed from all camera groups.

To remove `food.main.pizza.salami` from camera group *Pizza-POS* use the request:

```http request
DELETE /api/v1/camera-group/Pizza-POS/product/food.main.pizza.salami
```

Removing the product from the camera group functions similar to disabling it. In addition, the product won't be listed in labelling screen of the Dishtracker App.
At this point the product record is still present. To remove the product record use the request:

```http request
DELETE /api/v1/product/food.main.pizza.salami
```

### Change a product PLU and name

Changing the PLU or name of a product will change it for all Dishtracker App instances subscribed to any of the camera groups on the ProductSync instance.

To change the PLU and name of the product `food.main.pizza.salami` use a request like this:

```http request
PUT /api/v1/product/food.main.pizza.salami

{
  "label": "food.main.pizza.salami",
  "name": "Pizza Salami",
  "plu": "1122334455",
  "category": "food.main.pizza"
}
```

The fields `label` and `category` have to be included but can't be changed.

### Set today's menu

To replace the entire menu of camera group *Pizza-POS* a request like this can be used:

```http request
PUT /api/v1/camera-group/Pizza-POS/product

{
  "products": [
    {
      "enabled": true,
      "label": "food.main.pizza.salami"
    },
    {
      "enabled": false,
      "label": "food.main.pizza.diabolo"
    }
  ]
}
```

For product items with `enabled` set to `true`, the product status will be set to true.
For product items with `enabled` set to `false`, the product status will be set to false.
Any product status the camera group has which is not included in this list be set to false as well.

This is endpoint is useful to integrate ProductSync with a menu planner software.

get.description: Get the active status of products in this camera group.

put.description: Set the active status of products in this camera group. Products not included in the request are deactivated.

get.description: Get the active status of one product in the camera group.

put.description: Set the active status of one product in the camera group.

delete.description: Remove a product from the camera group. This effectively deactivates the product but doesn't remove the product from the system. Use `DELETE /api/v1/product/{label}` instead if you want to remove the product from the system entirely.

CategoryRequest.title: CategoryRequest
CategoryRequest.description:
Entity for creating a new category.

- **label**: Category label, hierarchical structured identifier of the category.
- **parent_category_label**:
- **name**: Human readable Category name.

tags.description: A camera group represents any number of Dishtracker App instances which have the same set of products (menu) enabled.

tags.description: The product resource represents a menu item.

tags.description: A product status represents whether a product is enabled for camera group.

tags.name: ProductSync
tags.description:
Having all the OpenAPI endpoints under a single tag is necessary to use
some OpenAPI tools like [OpenAPI Generator](https://openapi-generator.tech/)
effectively.
